notes.text:
An update for udisks2 is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Low. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
The Udisks project provides a daemon, tools, and libraries to access and manipulate disks, storage devices, and technologies.

Security Fix(es):

* udisks2: insecure defaults in user-accessible mount helpers allow for a DoS (CVE-2021-3802)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

Additional Changes:

For detailed information on changes in this release, see the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.6 Release Notes linked from the References section.
notes.title: Details

document.title: Red Hat Security Advisory: udisks2 security and bug fix update

notes.text: A vulnerability found in udisks2. This flaw allows an attacker to input a specially crafted image file/USB leading to kernel panic. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: udisks2: insecure defaults in user-accessible mount helpers allow for a DoS
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Mounting a file system is a privileged operation controlled by polkit, So without admin authentication, it's difficult to exploit. And as for the Unprivileged users with an active session(e.g. GNOME session) can be affected by the auto-mounted devices. Hence the Priority is changed to low.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: udisks2: insecure defaults in user-accessible mount helpers allow for a DoS
